H0.text: Friction is the force that causes objects to be pulled toward Earth.

H1.text: Gravity is the force that causes objects to be pulled toward Earth.

H2.text: Light is the force that causes objects to be pulled toward Earth.

H3.text: Electricity is the force that causes objects to be pulled toward Earth.

A4.text: The force of gravity experienced by objects on Earth's surface is the vector sum of two forces: (a) The gravitational attraction in accordance with Newton's universal law of gravitation, and (b) the centrifugal force, which results from the choice of an earthbound, rotating frame of reference.

A5.text: The strength of the gravitational field is numerically equal to the acceleration of objects under its influence.
